intro: Parameria vulneraria, commonly known as the wounded plant or the bloodroot, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and milky sap, which can cause skin irritation. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged in a rosette pattern. Parameria vulneraria is often found in rocky or arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
